                The South Korean band Stray Kids is coming to Roblox today, and they'll be unleashing the SKZOO from now and through the weekend while promoting their new album, Do It. As seen in the clips below, Stray Kids' anthropomorphic avatars will be performing their songs in-game as virtual concerts.Stray Kids-related items are also hidden in four different Roblox experiences, with two items per game. Players can collect all eight items and bring them to the Block to watch Stray Kids perform and receive additional free items from the band. However, this event will only run until 10 AM PT/1 PM ET on Monday, December 22.In other Roblox-related news, the platform has been banned in Russia and accused of negatively impacting children, and apparently considers the dissemination of LGBTQIA+ content to be a crime. But Russia isn't alone with its accusations that Roblox hasn't done enough to protect kids from child exploitation and grooming. A June 2024 Bloomberg investigation reported that the platform is rampant with predators. More recently, Florida and Texas have sued Roblox over that issue.Last month, Roblox revealed new initiatives to keep children from talking to strangers, and limit their interactions to kids roughly their own age. Roblox CEO David Baszucki has "categorically rejected" the lawsuits' depiction of the platform's safety measures. He also said that Roblox has done "an incredible job at innovating" and added that it's "constantly getting better" at protecting children's ability to chat with each other in-game.

                                                                                                                                                               It's down to the wire, and if you're looking to do some last-minute holiday shopping, we've got a great option for you. For a limited time, TOSY's wildly popular Magnet Pyramid Stone is on sale for just $22.76 (was $30) on Amazon, and is a perfect stocking stuffer to pick up if you're cutting it close with your gift-getting this year. You can create a seemingly endless number of shapes with it (the brand claims "one billion" of them), making it an effective and creative fidget toy for both kids and adults. But if you plan to pick one up, do it soon--these are popular on Amazon even at full price, and we expect this limited-time discount will only make them more in-demand.                                 TOSY Magnet Pyramid Stone                                                                $22.76 (was $30)                                                                                                                                                                                    The TOSY Magnet Pyramid Stone is a unique STEM and fidget toy that allows you to let your creativity run wild. With it, you can create a vast number of shapes, all while stimulating your brain and calming your anxieties. The Pyramid Stone even comes with a spinning base so you can show off your favorite creations. The toy is extremely popular on Amazon, and it's currently sitting at a limited-time discount of just $22.76 (down from $30). It's the perfect size (and price) for a stocking stuffer gift, so get one on sale while you still can.                      TOSY also makes a bunch of other great stocking-stuffer-type gifts, from fidget spinners to magnetic puzzle cubes. If the pyramid isn't doing it for you (or you just want more than one gift), maybe one of these other options will.                                                                                                                                                                It's the most festive time of the year, and if you're looking to do some last-minute gift-shopping, what's better than a bundle of classic '80s action movies? Available exclusively on Amazon, cinephiles--or shoppers looking to get something for their dad--can grab the Totally Awesome 80s 4K Blu-ray bundle. The collection, which launched just a few days ago on December 16, includes 4K Blu-ray editions of five acclaimed 1980s films, plus bonus materials and digital streaming copies of each movie. The Totally Awesome 80s bundle in stock and available for $55 at Amazon.                                 Totally Awesome 80s Box Set (4K)                                                                $55                                                                                                                                                                                    The Totally Awesome 80s Box Set compiles 4K Blu-ray editions of five classic movies released by Paramount Pictures throughout the 1980s:Beverly Hills CopFerris Bueller's Day OffTop GunTrading PlacesThe UntouchablesThat's a nice selection of some of the decade's most notable action, comedy, and drama flicks. The 4K Blu-ray releases for each film support Dolby Vision, HDR10, and Dolby Atmos audio, and offer their own selection of bonus materials, including new behind-the-scenes documentaries, deleted scenes, music videos, audio commentary tracks, and more.                      If you've never seen these films, then you've missed out on some of the most influential movies of all time. Top Gun was a blockbuster hit that cemented Tom Cruise's stardom, combining incredible aerial photography and action set against some of the era's chart-topping pop and rock songs. Ferris Bueller's Day Off, one of John Hughes' best films, follows Bueller (Mathew Broderick), his girlfriend Sloane (Mia Sara), and his best bud Cameron (Alan Ruck) as they take an unscheduled break from school. The Untouchables is a ruthless turn-of-the-century gangster movie with an all-star cast, while Trading Places saw John Landis put his own spin on Wall Street, and Beverly Hills Cop is a breakout action-comedy hit that made Eddie Murphy a household name.Lots more vintage movie Blu-rays are currently on sale, if you're hunting for easy stocking-stuffers.
